alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 12:34PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Tanana And Nenana Rivers from Nenana to Old Minto * WHEN...Until 300 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is bankfull from Nenana to Old Minto with minor flooding occurring in some low lying areas. The lower Nenana River at Nenana is also bankfull and may experience minor flooding. Water levels will remain near minor flood stage the next several days and areas around Nenana may see water going overbank into low lying areas near the river. Additionally, rising groundwater may start to impact crawl spaces or pond in Nenana. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1222 PM AKDT Mon, Heavy rain that fell over the Alaska Range the past week is causing high water on the Nenana and Tanana Rivers from Nenana to Old Minto. The Tanana and Nenana Rivers are bankfull, and will fall very slowly this week. Rain over the next several days will cause water levels to fluctuate slightly. - For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana and Nenana Rivers, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. - For Tanana River at Nenana: At Noon Monday the stage was 10.9 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Forecast: The river is expected to fall very slowly this week, but will fluctuate slightly with rainfall over the next several days. - http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana and Nenana Rivers from Nenana to Old Minto stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
